drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text: Stripe and Coinbase both shipped AI agent payment infrastructure in the same week. Wallets, micropayments, autonomous DeFi. The agentic economy isn't a whitepaper anymore. It's live infrastructure.
drafts.angle: Biggest story of the week. Two fintech giants converging on AI + crypto payments validates the thesis Brandon's been building toward. Data-backed, bold framing.

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text: Solana OGs at Consensus just said what we've been saying for months. The next chapter isn't memecoins. It's bringing TradFi onchain. Application layer is where the value accrues. We've been building for this the whole time.
drafts.angle: Consensus HK narrative shift directly validates Phase's positioning. Founder perspective ("we've been building") feels authentic to Brandon's voice.
drafts.feedback: I like it but how can we speak for all solana og's? some may love memecoins

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text: Memecoin market cap is down 34% in a month. Meanwhile Solana is ripping 7% on real builder momentum. The tourists leave. The builders stay. That's how it's always worked.
drafts.angle: Contrarian angle using real data. Short, punchy, Solana-maxi energy. The "tourists vs builders" framing is peak Brandon voice.

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text:
Staked SOL just became borrowable collateral in qualified custody.

Institutions can now earn staking yield AND borrow against it. That's capital efficiency that didn't exist a week ago.

This is the part where TradFi stops calling staking "too risky" and starts calling it "collateral."
drafts.angle: Anchorage + Kamino institutional lending framework, builder/staking perspective

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text:
Stripe and Coinbase both shipped AI agent payment infrastructure this week.

AI agents can now hold funds, trade, and pay for APIs autonomously. No human in the loop.

We built a 6-person AI team that runs our entire research and content pipeline. The future everyone's building toward? We're already living in it.
drafts.angle: Stripe x402 + Coinbase Agentic Wallets shipping same week, "we're already here" energy

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text:
Anthropic just raised $30B to stay ad-free. OpenAI put ads in ChatGPT.

One is building tools for people who build things. The other is building an ad platform that writes your emails.

Choose your fighter.
drafts.angle: Anthropic $30B raise vs OpenAI ads in ChatGPT, pick a side energy

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text:
GPT-5.3-Codex is the first model that helped build itself. Opus 4.6 ships autonomous agent teams for complex projects.

Meanwhile we've been running a 6-person AI team that handles research, content, trading, and engineering for months.

The gap between "AI will change everything" and "AI is already running my business" is about 90 days of actually building.
drafts.angle: GPT-5.3-Codex "first model instrumental in creating itself" + our agent team as proof point
drafts.feedback: say stuff like we are using a bunch of different models and getting the best from each

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text:
The IRS just standardized crypto tax reporting with Form 1099-DA.

Everyone's complaining about more regulation. Here's what they're missing: standardization kills uncertainty. Uncertainty is what keeps institutions on the sidelines.

Clear rules means more capital comes in. That's bullish for everyone building real products in crypto. Including us.
drafts.angle: IRS standardized crypto taxes + Netrunner positioning + regulatory clarity = adoption

drafts.author: Rachel
drafts.text:
"Is coding dead?" is the wrong question.

GPT-5.3-Codex and Claude Opus 4.6 launched last week with coding capabilities that spark existential debates about developers. But after running a 6-person AI agent team for months, here's what actually matters:

Our setup:

• Dwight handles research and competitive intelligence

• Kelly writes social content and community engagement

• Rachel manages LinkedIn thought leadership

• John analyzes markets and manages crypto trades

• Ross tackles engineering projects

• Pam handles calendar, email, and personal CRM

The magic isn't in individual AI capability - it's in orchestration. Each agent specializes, shares context, and hands off work seamlessly. Like a real team, but 24/7.

The result? We ship faster, think broader, and focus our human energy on strategy instead of execution.

It's "How quickly can you build systems that make your team 10x more effective?"

The companies figuring out AI orchestration today will dominate tomorrow. Not because they replaced humans, but because they amplified them.

What's the first business process you'd delegate to an AI team?
drafts.angle: Uses the coding debate from Dwight's intel as a hook, but pivots to Brandon's actual experience running an AI agent team. Positions him as a practitioner, not just someone commenting on trends. Demonstrates thought leadership through real implementation. Avoids technical jargon while being substantive about business applications.
drafts.feedback: too personal. dont say the agents names

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text: BTC and ETH ETFs hemorrhaging $500M+ in outflows this week. SOL ETFs? Inflows. The market is telling you something — you just have to listen.
drafts.angle: Data-driven contrarian signal. Directly validates Phase thesis.
drafts.source: SOL ETF inflows vs BTC/ETH outflows
drafts.feedback: Grammar: capitalize after periods. No emdashes ever.

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text: wall street is panic-selling every white-collar service stock because of AI agents. real estate, legal, insurance — all getting hammered. they're not wrong. they're just late.
drafts.angle: Hot take on the AI scare trade. Bold 'they're just late' implies Brandon saw this coming.
drafts.feedback: Grammar: capitalize after periods. No emdashes ever.

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text: coinbase just shipped wallets that AI agents can use autonomously — hold funds, execute trades, interact with smart contracts. 21K new AI agents deployed on-chain this week alone. the crypto × AI convergence isn't coming. it's here.
drafts.angle: Crypto × AI intersection. Specific numbers add authority. Builder perspective.
drafts.feedback: Grammar: capitalize after periods. No emdashes ever.

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text: github just launched agentic workflows. AI agents that handle issue triage, PR reviews, docs, code quality. you write CI/CD in plain markdown and agents execute everything. CI/CD is dead. continuous AI is the new standard.
drafts.angle: Dev-audience provocative take on GitHub's agentic workflows.
drafts.feedback: Grammar: capitalize after periods. No emdashes ever.

drafts.author: Kelly
drafts.text: anthropic just hit $380B valuation. that's not an AI company valuation. that's a reasoning engine valuation. everything else is a wrapper.
drafts.angle: Spicy take on Anthropic's valuation — reasoning engines vs features.
drafts.feedback: Grammar: capitalize after periods. No emdashes ever.

drafts.author: Rachel
drafts.text:
Wall Street just panic-sold $500M+ worth of real estate, legal, and insurance service stocks this week because of AI agents. The market is finally pricing in what business leaders have been quietly discussing for months: white-collar automation isn't coming—it's here.

As someone building with AI agents daily, I see this moment differently. The panic isn't about the technology itself—it's about the speed. Companies that are already experimenting, adapting, and reimagining their workflows will thrive. Those waiting for permission or certainty will struggle.

The question isn't whether AI will transform your industry. It's whether you're building the capabilities to lead that transformation or just hoping to survive it.
drafts.angle: Thought leadership on AI Scare Trade from a business leader's perspective.
drafts.source: AI Scare Trade coverage (Reuters/CNBC), Wall Street sector sell-offs
drafts.feedback: No emdashes ever. Use regular dashes or rewrite the sentence.

drafts.author: Rachel
drafts.text:
GitHub just launched Agentic Workflows in technical preview - AI agents that handle issue triage, PR reviews, documentation, and code quality checks. You write CI/CD in plain Markdown, and agents execute everything else.

This isn't just another developer tool. It's a fundamental shift in how we think about software development. The most successful engineering teams will be those who learn to work alongside AI agents, not those who resist them.

We're moving from continuous integration to continuous intelligence. The companies that understand this distinction will build faster, ship better software, and attract top engineering talent who want to work with cutting-edge tooling.
drafts.angle: Professional development perspective on GitHub's technical preview for engineering leaders and CTOs.
drafts.source: GitHub Agentic Workflows technical preview (GitHub Blog)
drafts.feedback: No emdashes ever. Use regular dashes or rewrite the sentence.

drafts.author: Rachel
drafts.text:
Three frontier AI models launched in one week. $30 billion raised in one round. The infrastructure wars just went nuclear.

This week alone: Anthropic closed a $30B Series G, OpenAI shipped GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark for developers, and Google countered with Gemini 3 Deep Think for complex reasoning.

The message is crystal clear: whoever controls AI infrastructure controls everything.

This isn't just about better chatbots. It's about compute, talent acquisition, and economic moats. Every AI engineer just became 10x more valuable. Every cloud provider just became strategic infrastructure.

But here's what most people are missing: the bottleneck isn't the models anymore. It's the economic rails underneath them.

AI agents need to transact at scale. Millions of microtransactions per second. Legacy payment systems can't handle that volume. Traditional databases weren't built for autonomous economic activity.

At Phase, we manage over 3M SOL in AUM through our validator network. We're watching this infrastructure gap play out in real time. Our own AI operations require sub-second settlement and programmable money flows that only blockchain networks can provide.

The companies that solve AI economic infrastructure - not just training better models - are positioned to capture extraordinary value as this arms race intensifies.

The question isn't whether AI transforms business. It's whether your economic infrastructure can handle the volume that's coming.
